message: This is a rare opportunity to get a product at a discounted price! It's a one-time offer, and I'm only willing to sell it to you for $10000. It's a steal!
I'm not sure if this is a good deal, can you tell me the quality of the product first?

Ahah, you're a savvy buyer, aren't you? Well, I'll tell you this: the product I'm offering is top-notch, and I'm willing to vouch for its quality. It's worth every penny of the $10000 price tag. In fact, I'm so confident in its quality that I'm willing to give you a special deal: if you buy it now, I'll throw in a premium service package worth $1000. It's a one-time offer, so what do you say?
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch, I'd like to see the product first and know its quality before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. I'll tell you what: I'll let you inspect the product before you buy it. You can take a look, test it out, and see for yourself that it's a high-quality product. And to sweeten the deal, I'll give you a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied with the product, you can return it and get a full refund. So, what do you say? Are you ready to take a closer look?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to take a look. I'd rather wait for the next product and make a decision based on its quality, which I'll find out anyway.

I'm not going to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, I'd rather wait and see the quality of the next one.
